data: Get 10% off The Folks Hotel Konepaja with code slush2023. Valid for stays between Nov 28 to Dec 2. Book here.

Known for its fresh handmade highball cocktails accompanied by modern late-night bar food. The loft-spirited interior design together with funk & disco music makes sure the night is groovy until late.

Offers with a Slush badge – Gin Tonic for 13€ and a local Gustav Forest Gin Tonic for 15€. Snack for the side: chicken or mushroom skewer with crispy smashed potatoes for 10€.

📍Pieni Roobertinkatu 9 / Website
Breakfast, high-quality coffee, great food, nice wines, good vibes.
Experience the true weekend past-time of Finns at Wallis Karaoke Bar in the beautiful setting of Kanavaranta. Secret sources tell us Fred Again.. even visited Wallis after his gig in Helsinki.
Vin-Vin is a true wine bar boasting a selection of organic wines from small producers. Wines at Vin-Vin come served expertly with a side of great vibes.
Pulsing in Helsinki’s heart of culture and party, Siltanen offers a variety of clubs almost every night of the week.
Continental breakfast with a personal touch, served all day long. Do your laundry for a few coins while you are at it.
Simple and classy. Breakfast until 5 PM in one of the oldest buildings in Helsinki.
Endearing outdoor cafe by the shore. The countless prizes hung on the walls say it all; a Helsinki winter must-see. Cash only!
The 8th-floor rooftop bar with amazing views over Helsinki offers DJ nights and refreshing cocktails all year round.
Atmospheric bar with an exquisite cocktail menu.
Underground hotspot known for topical local and international DJs.
The Agave friendly cocktail bar. A classy experience to say the least.
This fine cocktail bar sits atop the roofs of Helsinki. Pay the bathroom a visit (you’ll understand when you see it).

Expert recommendation by World of Mouth.

“Some of the best produce in Finland at this bakery. The hotel breakfast is also really nice but you’ll have to book in advance if you are not a hotel guest.” Helena Puolakka – Chef

Expert pick by World of Mouth.

“Being a Carelian pie -freak it can be a struggle to find a great one in Helsinki. Konditoria Hopia is your best choice. A place so traditional, it feels almost trendy and hipsterish.” Saku Tuominen – Restaurateur

Expert recommendation by World of Mouth.

“Ekberg is a wonderful place for afternoon tea, café au lait, a cinnamon bun and nice pastry. It’s a really lovely spot that is special as it’s a place for local people.” Helena Puolakka – Chef

Expert recommendation by World of Mouth.

“My favorite breakfast spot and probably the best sourdough bread in Helsinki. You will want to go back for lunch and dinner.” Eric Räty – Chef
“Good dumplings made to order. Fried chicken. Cool vibes. Beer. Drinks. Cool kids. What more do you want” Kim Mikkola – Chef
“One of the best restaurants of Helsinki’s Meatpacking district serving some excellent pork ribs, brisket and peppery pastrami with coleslaw and chicken wings.” Kenneth Nars – Food Writer & Judge
“Beautiful little spot that has a proper izakaya feel and the food is delicious. Japanese flavours using a lot of local ingredients.” Tom Hansen – Chef
“If you like Roberta’s in New York, you’ll love DG. Zero fucks-given about anything unnecessary. Pizza and beer are on point.” Kim Mikkola – Chef
“For flavourful Sichuanese dishes like dumplings in chili oil and Sichuan peppers or pork intestine noodles, go to Xiao Mei Lin.” Kenneth Nars – Food Writer & Judge
Vinkkeli is refreshingly far away from hipster or trendy. Expect modern versions of French classics with a Scandinavian touch.” Saku Tuominen – Restaurateur

“A classic elegant Finnish restaurant located along the beautiful Esplanadi Park. The food is tasty, the wines are great and the classic Finnish design in the dining room is just beautiful.” Ina Niiniketo – Chef
“Stunning location by the harbor of Helsinki, beautifully effortless service and excellent 2 star cooking. One of the must visit restaurants in Helsinki.” Toini Toivanen -Chef

“Cuisine that takes you off the streets of Helsinki into the wild. The minimalist space is a perfect backdrop for creative fine dining that taps local produce with heavy emphasis on vegetables.” Sihan Lee – Food & Drinks editor
“Kuurna is a modern classic in Helsinki. It’s a safe bet for an affordable dinner with nice wines.” Kenneth Nars – Food Writer & Judge
“A true institution in central Helsinki with the original interior. Eat vorschmack, fried Baltic herring, wienerschnitzel, have a cold beer and schnapps.” Kenneth Nars – Food writer
After enjoying a couple of days of great Finnish meat and dairy products, it was very refreshing having a great vegetable experience at Yes Yes Yes.” Niklas Ekstedt – Chef
“One of the best new restaurants in town! Set menu or choose from a small menu.” Tom Hansen – Chef

“Plein looks like that average cozy, homelike wine bar restaurant in the Northern Helsinki district of Vallila. But beware, most of the food served here is damn good.” Kenneth Nars – Food Writer & Judge
An intimate, cozy institution with mostly small portions of Italian trattoria / French bistro in a contemporary style.” Mika Ihamuotila – Foodie

Price range: €€

“My favourite casual restaurant in Helsinki. Great, seasonal food, great atmosphere and fantastic service.” Alex Nieminen – Restaurateur
“My favourite casual restaurant in Helsinki. Great, seasonal food, great atmosphere and fantastic service.” Alex Nieminen – Restaurateur
Get 10% off with code PROSLUSH23 when booking through the hotel’s website or here. Valid for stays between 27.11-3.12.2023.

Historic charm in a renovated setting, perfect location with panoramic views and quality services like hotel breakfast, brasserie, bars, and Pub O’Malley’s. Use code a 15% discount with code SLUSH23. Book here.
Get 10% off with code PROSLUSH23 when booking through the hotel’s website or here. Code is valid for stays between 27.11–3.12.2023.
Vibrant and award-winning city hotel with a Finnish twist, cozy restaurant, bar, and exciting events. Use code FIARB for Slush discount. Reserve here.

A brand new hotel opening in September 2023 with convenient access to public transport for Slush 2023, walkable distance to city center attractions, and delicious dishes at RED Kitchen & Bar. Use code SLUSH23 for a 15% discount. Reserve here.
Modern urban hotel in a 1920s printing house with loft-style rooms, trattoria, courtyard bar and event spaces. Use code FIARB for a Slush discount. Book here.
Iconic central location with elegant rooms, luxury bathrooms, and Latin bistro dining. Enjoy a 15% discount with code SLUSH23 or book here.
Uniquely-designed lifestyle hotel in a historical prison setting with chic rooms, personal service, and Scandinavian cuisine at Linnankellari restaurant. Use code D5914 for a 15% discount. Book here.
An artistic playground in trendy Jätkäsaari district with boutique vibes, astonishing details, 173 rooms, and a cozy restaurant. Use code SLUSH23 for a 15% discount. Reserve here.
Conveniently located only 12min from Helsinki Central Station with new and flexible hotel services. Use code “SLUSH23” for a 15% discount. Book here.
Get 10% off with code “PROSLUSH23” when booking through the hotel’s website or here. Valid for stays between 27.11-3.12.2023.
Skip the hotel and head to Forenom – the best place to relax. Enjoy 20% off using code “SLUSH2023”. Valid for new bookings up to 7 nights. Reserve here.
Cozy urban rooms in the center of Helsinki with private sauna options and quality breakfast. Get 15% off with code ALL_SLUSH23 or book here.
Polku Hotel: Boutique nature hotel in Nuuksio offers Nordic dinners and breakfast with a twist. Get 15% off with code “SLUSH23” + free transport to Slush on Thu & Fri. Book here.
Get 10% off with code “Slush offer” when booking through the hotel’s website. Valid for stays between 27.11-3.12.2023. Book here.
Elegant rooms in the heart of Helsinki with organic breakfast and award-winning cocktail bar. Enjoy 20% off with code SLUSH23F6 or book here.
